post.body: oh I remember the Nemo phase. it's a long long phase mind you.
@firstdogonmoon must be a very special dog. The only thing my dogs ever make would not be something I'd feature as an avatar.
but now I really want to know what you were looking for. Pornographic poultry?
Thanks. My boy has to go for the less popular heroes. Insistant that he needs The Flash or Green Lantern. Can't find either.
I wonder if he'd go for Iron Man. maybe. Thanks!
I've done both, looks like you can get halloween costumes of menopausal pjs. no inbetween ground.
it doesn't sound like she's all that ready, but maybe keep going for another day, see if it clicks.
And have her help clean up. if there is pee on the floor, she wipes it up, she takes off the wet clothes too. It can help.
This is going to sound cruel, but don't change them right away, wait a minute they'll feel a little cold. No pants helps too
Happy flu year!
better than a resolution any time.
Mine's sick today too and we've decided to hold off a little longer due to some digestive issues. I'm ready now, he's just not
If you put her in cotton underpants, might discover she dislikes it bit more to be wet. can be messy at first, but might help
I'd agree. She needs to want to stay dry and clean to make it work.
I pick the secret option, chipotle sweet potato and mushroom. They're heavenly. But I like the cheese ones too
Oh no! Sorry to hear your new year is off to a bad start. At least she's going to be ok.
I agree. And I only see this little girl in photos for the most part so it is especially hard to judge.
Ooh, I will. She's turning three in Feb, but my boys were always a year ahead in clothing sizes.
Sons are very into the Justice League, older boy wants Flash pajamas. I googled and all I can find are "hot flash" pajamas. Um, not those.
given the choice of pork, duck or cheese tamale, 5 year old always chooses duck. I think we have a budding foodie here.
